thread.title: Mild weather in St. Louis breaks third temperature record this year
thread.title_full: Mild weather in St. Louis breaks third temperature record this year

author: From staff reports
title: Mild weather in St. Louis breaks third temperature record this year
text:
Buy Now Laurie Skrivan 
Lindsey Wallach of St. Louis enjoys her day off as a nanny reading "The Matchmaker" on Art Hill in Forest Park on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. The metropolitan area continues to enjoy spring like weather in February. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, Buy Now Laurie Skrivan 
"We both from Illinois so we are getting used to crazy warm weather here. It's a condition of winter now," said Trevor Hanlon, 20, who hangs in a hammock with Alison Bennett, 20, in Forest Park on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. They both attend St. Louis University. The metropolitan area continues to enjoy spring like weather in February. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, Buy Now Laurie Skrivan 
Adeline Lamb, 9, pulls a daring move leaping on and off a bridge while enjoying a paddle boat ride with her cousin Lexi Zolman of Chesterfield on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017, in Forest Park. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, Buy Now Laurie Skrivan

The metropolitan area continues to enjoy spring like weather in February. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, featured Mild weather in St. Louis breaks third temperature record this year From staff reports Buy Now Laurie Skrivan 
Lindsey Wallach of St. Louis enjoys her day off as a nanny reading "The Matchmaker" on Art Hill in Forest Park on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. The metropolitan area continues to enjoy spring like weather in February. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, lskrivan@post-dispatch.com Buy Now Laurie Skrivan 
"We both from Illinois so we are getting used to crazy warm weather here. It's a condition of winter now," said Trevor Hanlon, 20, who hangs in a hammock with Alison Bennett, 20, in Forest Park on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. They both attend St. Louis University. The metropolitan area continues to enjoy spring like weather in February. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, lskrivan@post-dispatch.com Buy Now Laurie Skrivan 
Adeline Lamb, 9, pulls a daring move leaping on and off a bridge while enjoying a paddle boat ride with her cousin Lexi Zolman of Chesterfield on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017, in Forest Park. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, lskrivan@post-dispatch.com Buy Now Laurie Skrivan 
Lindsey Wallach of St. Louis enjoys her day off as a nanny reading "The Matchmaker" on Art Hill in Forest Park on Monday, Feb. 20, 2017. The metropolitan area continues to enjoy spring like weather in February. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, lskrivan@post-dispatch.com 
For the third time this year, St. Louis’ no-show winter has broken a temperature record. 
The National Weather Service says it reached 79 degrees at 1:46 p.m. Monday, one degree warmer than the record for Feb. 20. The old one didn’t last long — one year ago, a record high was set at 78. 
Before then, the record was 77 degrees, set in 1996. 
Since Jan. 1, temperatures in St. Louis have been above average for all but 11 days. And on 25 days, daily averages have been at least 10 degrees warmer than usual. St. Louis also posted a record high on Jan. 10, when it hit 68 degrees, and on Feb. 11, at 74. 
The Weather Service says much of that was because of steady high-level wind from the West, part of the Pacific Ocean pattern that has drenched California. The pattern has kept Arctic cold bottled up far to the north and Gulf moisture to the south. 
The Weather Service says midday temperatures this week will remain above 70, or nearly so, through Friday. A cold front is expected that night, with a more seasonal low around 34 and a high near 47 on Saturday. 
Average high and low temperatures for late February are 48 and 30. 
There was an 80 percent chance of showers overnight Monday — a welcome thing, given that the area has not recorded significant rainfall since Jan. 19, when 0.4 inches was recorded at St. Louis Lambert International Airport. Since Jan. 1, the area has had only 1.9 inches, or 2.1 inches below normal, through Sunday. Tags
